alert.note: Alert for Northwest St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 8:10PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Tammany, southeastern Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and central Pearl River Counties through 845 PM CST... At 809 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Crossroads to Covington. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. Minor street flooding possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Covington, Poplarville, Abita Springs, Sun, Bush, Crossroads and Mcneil. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 54 and 55. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 17 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
